page.title: 16Legends
page.content: The first thing of interest to the legend hunter in this area is the {tunnel}reputed to have been built by the Saxons to connect the church of St Wystans to Newton Solney Church a distance of over 4 miles. Legend has it that the{ Vikings}sailed up the Old Trent and came into conflict with the{Anglo-Saxons}and that there was a huge and bloody battle. In 1726 a certain Dr.Degge was told by a labourer that he had unearthed a stone dormitory inside which was a 9 foot coffin. The labourer claimed that it contained a{giant}surrounded by 100 men with their feet pointing in towards the giant. He took the skull and planted a sycamore seed on top of it. The tree is still growing and in 1920 the grave was rediscovered again but with no sign of the giant.
